discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
VDI is about virtualization (with hypervisor).

The network environments -> in some cases application performances could be affected by network, but that's not a "VDI administrator" environment, can be noticed by "network administrator".

"Client devices" -> are just stupid devices without any real performance

"Container resources" -> here we are speaking about virtualization(ig. VMWare vSphere) not "containerization" (ig. docker)

the best solution is: Server resources.

VDI (Virtual Desktop Infrastructure) is where a hypervisor segments a server(s) into virtual machines that in turn host virtual desktops, which users access remotely from their devices. Users can access these virtual desktops from any device and all processing is done on the host server. https://www.vmware.com/topics/glossary/content/virtual-desktop-infrastructure-vdi

The question seems more about the Federation, obviously federation needs "Access Controls" as you need "Certificate auth".

The best solution here is B - Federation

choices.B: Create three /25 subnets in different regions
choices.F: Create three /27 subnets in different regions
choices.E: Create two /27 subnets in different regions
choices.D: Create three /26 subnets in different regions
choices.C: Create two /26 subnets in different regions
choices.A: Create two /25 subnets in different regions

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
/26 creates 4 networks with 64hosts per network, using this strategy you lost 1 network because answert doesn't provides "4 different regions".

That's why the best solution is to subnet the network with CIDR /25: here you can have two networks in two different regions, each network can have 128hosts-2(network and broadcast)

comments.content: Agree with you, tricky is 60 + 5 > 64 address (/26). So the answer must be A.

discussion.content: Correct answer A: 60 nodes + 5 reserved network IP addresses. The CIDR /25 allows for 126 valid IP addresses and 2 network addresses.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
B. Install a Type 2 hypervisor -> No advantages to deploy twice the application with different versions
C. Enable SR-IOV on the host -> No matters.
D. Create snapshots -> concerned to OS updates, not used for app updates, not in this scenario.
